      • insert

        public int insert​(java.sql.Connection connection,
                  User user)
           throws DbException,
                  ValidationException
        MySQL specific realization of UserDao.insert(Connection, User) method. Inserts a row to the table users with data specified in user.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface UserDao
        Parameters:
        connection - an instance of Connection to reach the database.
        user - a user to be inserted.
        Returns:
        the id of the inserted User.
        Throws:
        DbException - is thrown if data cannot be deleted.
        ValidationException - is thrown if user data is incorrect or user with same id or email is already exists in the database

        public java.util.Optional<User> get​(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                    int id)
                             throws DbException
        MySQL specific realization of UserDao.get(Connection, int) method. Method get retrieves a row from the table users by the specified id. If table does not contain a row with specified id returns empty Optional.
        Specified by:
        get in interface UserDao
        Parameters:
        connection - an instance of Connection to reach the database.
        id - id of a user to find.
        Returns:
        Optional representing a row from the table.
        Throws:
        DbException - is thrown if data cannot be retrieved.

                                    java.lang.String email)
                             throws DbException
        MySQL specific realization of UserDao.get(Connection, String) method. Retrieves a row from the table users by the specified email. If table does not contain a row with specified email returns empty Optional.
        Specified by:
        get in interface UserDao
        Parameters:
        connection - an instance of Connection to reach the database.
        email - email of a user to find.

                  throws java.sql.SQLException
